description: Base questions that determine the flow of subsequent detailed questions. These are qualifying questions that lead to specific income/deduction collection paths.

questions.questionText: What is your primary source of income?
questions.explanation: Your primary income source determines which forms and calculations apply. Employment income uses PAYE (Pay As You Earn), while business income requires detailed profit/loss tracking.
questions.helpText: Select your main source of income. If you have multiple sources, select the one that generates the most income.

questions.explanation: Your housing situation determines if you can claim rent relief (20% of rent, max ₦500,000) or mortgage interest deductions. Rent relief is a deduction that reduces your taxable income.
questions.helpText: Select the option that best describes your current housing arrangement.

questions.questionText: Do you contribute to any of the following?
questions.explanation: Contributions to NHF, NHIS, Pension, and Life Insurance are tax-deductible, meaning they reduce your taxable income. You can select multiple options if you contribute to more than one.
questions.helpText: Select all that apply. These contributions can reduce the tax you pay.

questions.questionText: Do you have any additional sources of income?
questions.explanation: Additional income sources must be declared and may be taxed differently. Rental income and investment income have specific tax treatments.
questions.helpText: Select all that apply. Even if you selected a primary source above, you should declare all income sources.

questions.questionText: Did you sell or dispose of any assets during the tax year?
questions.explanation: Capital gains tax applies when you sell assets like property, shares, or other investments. Some disposals are exempt (like principal residence once in lifetime, or personal chattels under ₦5M).
questions.helpText: Answer 'Yes' if you sold any property, shares, vehicles, or other valuable assets during the tax year.

questions.questionText: Do any of these exemptions apply to you?
options: I earn minimum wage or less
I work in agricultural business (first 5 years)
I work in a combat zone or hazardous area
questions.explanation: Certain individuals and income types are exempt from tax. Minimum wage earners, agricultural businesses (first 5 years), and military officers have specific exemptions.
questions.helpText: Select all that apply. These exemptions may reduce or eliminate your tax liability.

note: After these base questions, the system will ask detailed questions based on the answers. NIN/TIN collection happens after base questions are completed, before detailed income/deduction collection.
